TopicTitle: VAB techniques for multi-command module designs

Articles.Content: This question has come up before but I'm not sure what's changed between versions so I figured I'd bring it up again. I'm running version 0.23.5 through Steam and I'm having the hardest time building a rover attached to a transport ship. I can't get things to snap right, multi-part connections focus on the wrong command module, etc. I read that there used to be plugins that helped with this type of issue, but they appear to be gone so I'm thinking it's a resolved problem and I'm just missing something in the VAB? Any thoughts?
You might try creating the rover up as a sub assembly.

The plugin you're looking for is called "Select Root". No link handy, but I found it easily enough.

I had the very VAB woes you describe and it solved all of them. But for one somewhat asymmetric ship it introduced some parallax error when docking. The port was alright and functional, but when following the navball, things wouldn't line up. Cost me a solar panel, as I tend to rely on the instruments and didn't even look out of the window.
